info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 20 at 2:23PM CDT until April 20 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN HANCOCK AND MCDONOUGH COUNTIES... At 222 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Woodville, or 14 miles south of Carthage, moving northeast at 55 mph. A second severe thunderstorm was located near Warsaw also moving northeast. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Augusta, Plymouth and Hancock County Fairgrounds around 235 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Colmar, Tennessee, Fandon, Colchester, Argyle Lake State Park, Macomb, Industry, Western Illinois University, McDonough County 4-H Grounds, Spring Lake, Bardolph, Adair, Pennington Point, Macomb Municipal Airport, Bushnell and New Philadelphia. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Illinois. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
